xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Teredo IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>IPv6 transition technologies which tunnel packets through other protocols do not provide visibility.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> TCPIP Settings -> IPv6 Transition Technologies -> Teredo State to Enabled: Disabled State.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Application event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO. Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Event Log Service -> Application -> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Security event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO. Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Event Log Service -> Security -> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "196608" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Setup event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO. Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Event Log Service -> Setup -> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The System event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO. Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Event Log Service -> System -> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Fax service will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Unnecessary Services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Remove or disable the Fax (fax) service.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Microsoft FTP service must not be installed unless required.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Unnecessary Services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Uninstall or disable the Microsoft FTP Service (msftpsvc) service.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Peer Networking Identity Manager Service Disabled

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Peer Networking Identity Manager service will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Unnecessary Services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Remove or disable the Peer Networking Identity Manager (p2pimsvc) service.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Simple TCP/IP Services service will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Unnecessary Services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Remove or disable the Simple TCP/IP Services (simptcp) service.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Telnet service will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Unnecessary Services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Remove or disable the Telnet (tlntsvr) service.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Device Install Software Request Error Report

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Windows will be prevented from sending an error report when a device driver requests additional software during installation.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Sending error reports to vendors can disclose information about a system to an outside organization.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation -> Prevent Windows from sending an error report when a device driver requests additional software during installation to Enabled.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Unauthorized accounts will not have the "Add workstations to domain user right.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Add workstations to domain right may add computers to a domain. This could result in unapproved or incorrectly configured systems being added to a domain. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> User Rights Assignment -> "Add workstations to domain as defined in the Check section.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The DoD Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>To ensure secure DoD websites and DoD-signed code are properly validated, the system must trust the DoD Root Certificate Authorities (CAs). The DoD root certificates will ensure that the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the DoD CAs.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Install the DoD Root CA certificates. DoD Root CA 2 DoD Root CA 3 DoD Root CA 4
The InstallRoot tool is available on IASE at http://iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Install the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates on unclassified systems.
Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint DoD Root CA 2 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 1 - 22BBE981F0694D246CC1472ED2B021DC8540A22F DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - FFAD03329B9E527A43EEC66A56F9CBB5393E6E13 DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - FCE1B1E25374DD94F5935BEB86CA643D8C8D1FF4
Administrators should run the Federal Bridge Certification Authority (FBCA) Cross-Certificate Removal Tool once as an administrator and once as the current user.
The FBCA Cross-Certificate Remover tool and user guide is available on IASE at http://iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: WINRG-000001 Active Setup\Installed Components Registry Permissions

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Permissions on the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key must only allow privileged accounts to add or change registry values. If standard user accounts have this capability there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Maintain the default permissions of the following registry keys: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components\ HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components\ (64-bit systems only)
Users - Read Administrators - Full Control SYSTEM - Full Control CREATOR OWNER - Special (Special = Full Control - Subkeys only)

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system must be configured to audit DS Access - Directory Service Access successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit directory service access records events related to users accessing an Active Directory object.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls>ECAR-2, ECAR-3</IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Detailed auditing subcategories are configured in Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration. The summary level settings under Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Audit Policy will not be enforced (see V-14230).
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> DS Access -> Directory Service Access with Success selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system must be configured to audit DS Access - Directory Service Access failures.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit directory service access records events related to users accessing an Active Directory object.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls>ECAR-2, ECAR-3</IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Detailed auditing subcategories are configured in Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration. The summary level settings under Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Audit Policy will not be enforced (see V-14230).
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> DS Access -> Directory Service Access with Failure selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system must be configured to audit DS Access - Directory Service Changes successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit directory service changes records events related to changes made to objects in Active Directory Domain Services.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls>ECAR-2, ECAR-3</IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Detailed auditing subcategories are configured in Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration. The summary level settings under Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Audit Policy will not be enforced (see V-14230).
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> DS Access -> Directory Service Changes with Success selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system must be configured to audit DS Access - Directory Service Changes failures.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit directory service changes records events related to changes made to objects in Active Directory Domain Services.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls>ECAR-2, ECAR-3</IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Detailed auditing subcategories are configured in Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration. The summary level settings under Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Audit Policy will not be enforced (see V-14230).
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> DS Access -> Directory Service Changes with Failure selected.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Always Install with Elevated Privileges Disabled

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges must be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Standard user accounts must not be granted elevated privileges. Enabling Windows Installer to elevate privileges when installing applications can allow malicious persons and applications to gain full control of a system.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer -> "Always install with elevated privileges" to "Disabled".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Install the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate on unclassified systems.
Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint DoD Root CA 2 - US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA 1 - DA36FAF56B2F6FBA1604F5BE46D864C9FA013BA3
Administrators should run the Federal Bridge Certification Authority (FBCA) Cross-Certificate Removal Tool once as an administrator and once as the current user.
The FBCA Cross-Certificate Remover tool and user guide is available on IASE at http://iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Windows Server 2008 R2 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authorization Policy Change successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Authorization Policy Change records events related to changes in user rights, such as Create a token object.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Authorization Policy Change" with "Success" selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 Server" to "Disabled".
The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.
This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client driver" to "Enabled" with "Disable driver (recommended)" selected for "Configure MrxSmb10 driver".
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client (extra setting needed for pre-Win8.1/2012R2)" to "Enabled" with the following three lines of text entered for "Configure LanmanWorkstation Dependencies": Bowser MRxSmb20 NSI
The system must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
These policy settings requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Windows Server 2008 R2 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Account Lockout" with "Success" selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Windows Server 2008 R2 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Account Lockout" with "Failure" selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Windows Server 2008 R2 must be configured to audit System - Other System Events successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Other System Events" with "Success" selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Windows Server 2008 R2 must be configured to audit System - Other System Events failures.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Other System Events" with "Failure" selected.

metadata.title: Unsupported Service Packs
metadata.description: Systems must be at supported service packs (SP) or release levels.

criterion.comment: Verifies the OS Build is equal to or greater than 7601

metadata.title: Display Shutdown Button
metadata.description: The shutdown option must not be available from the logon dialog box.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Shutdown: Allow system to be shutdown without having to log on' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: NTFS Requirement
metadata.description: Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS.

criterion.comment: Verifies local volumes are formatted using NTFS

metadata.title: Legal Notice Display
metadata.description: The required legal notice must be configured to display before console logon.

criterion.comment: Legal Notice is configured with the required text.
Legal Notice is configured with the required text.

metadata.title: Caching of logon credentials
metadata.description: Caching of logon credentials must be limited.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive Logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)' is set to '2' logons or less
System is not a member of a domain

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous Network Shares
metadata.description: Anonymous enumeration of shares must be restricted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Bad Logon Attempts
metadata.description: The number of allowed bad logon attempts must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Bad Logon Counter Reset
metadata.description: Windows 2008 R2 must be configured for the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset to 15 minutes or greater.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least '15' minutes
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Lockout Duration
metadata.description: Windows 2008 R2 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Account lockout duration' is set to '0'
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
Verifies 'Account lockout duration' is set to '15 or greater'
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: UR: Act as part of the operating system
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Act as part of the operating system user right.

criterion.comment: Act as part of the operating system - None

metadata.title: Maximum Password Age
metadata.description: Maximum password age must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Maximum Password Age' is set to '60' days or less
Verifies 'Maximum Password Age' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Minimum Password Age
metadata.description: Minimum password age does not meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Password Uniqueness
metadata.description: Password uniqueness must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more

metadata.title: Disable Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Guest account status' is set to 'Disabled'
Verifies built-in guest account does not exist

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account must be renamed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Rename guest account' is set to a value other than 'Guest'
Verifies built-in guest account does not exist

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Administrator Account
metadata.description: The built-in administrator account must be renamed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Rename administrator account' is set to a value other than 'Administrator'

metadata.title: Forcibly Disconnect when Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: Users are not forcibly disconnected when logon hours expire.

metadata.title: Unencrypted Password is Sent to SMB Server.
metadata.description: Unencrypted password is sent to 3rd party SMB Server.

criterion.comment: Verifes 'MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)' is set to 'Disabled'
Verifies the automatic logon password registry value (DefaultPassword) does not exist

metadata.title: Microsoft Strong Password Filtering
metadata.description: The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Secure Print Driver Installation
metadata.description: The print driver installation privilege must be restricted to administrators.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Devices: Prevent users from installing printer drivers' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: LanMan Authentication Level
metadata.description: The Send download LanMan compatible password option is not set to Send NTLMv2 response only\refuse LM and NTLM.

metadata.title: Ctrl+Alt+Del Security Attention Sequence
metadata.description: Ctrl+Alt+Del security attention sequence is Disabled.

metadata.title: UR: Deny access to this computer from the network - Domain Controller
metadata.description: The Deny access to this computer from the network user right on domain controllers must be configured to prevent unauthenticated access.

criterion.comment: Deny access to this computer from the network - Guests

metadata.title: Smart Card Removal Option
metadata.description: The Smart Card removal option must be configured to Force Logoff or Lock Workstation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior' is set to 'Lock Workstation'
Verifies 'Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior' is set to 'Force Logoff'

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (if client agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB server is not enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

metadata.title: Encryption of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not encrypted when possible.

metadata.title: Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not signed when possible.

metadata.title: Computer Account Password Reset
metadata.description: The computer account password is prevented from being reset.

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (if server agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB client is not enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

metadata.title: Format and Eject Removable Media
metadata.description: Ejection of removable NTFS media is not restricted to Administrators.

metadata.title: Password Expiration Warning
metadata.description: Users are not warned in advance that their passwords will expire.

metadata.title: Global System Objects Permission Strength
metadata.description: The default permissions of Global system objects are not increased.

metadata.title: Idle Time Before Suspending a Session.
metadata.description: Amount of idle time required before suspending a session is improperly set.

metadata.title: Reversible Password Encryption
metadata.description: Reversible password encryption must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Disable Media Autoplay
metadata.description: The system is configured to autoplay removable media.

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths
metadata.description: Unauthorized registry paths must not be remotely accessible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths' is configured with no entries
Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths' is configured to contain authorized registry paths
Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths' is not configured

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Network Shares
metadata.description: Unauthorized shares must not be accessed anonymously.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously' is not configured
Verifies 'Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously' is blank

metadata.title: Limit Blank Passwords
metadata.description: The use of local accounts with blank passwords is not restricted to console logons only.

metadata.title: Undock Without Logging On
metadata.description: The system can be removed from the docking station without logging on first.

metadata.title: Maximum Machine Account Password Age
metadata.description: The maximum age for machine account passwords must be set to requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is set to '30' days or less
Verifies 'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Strong Session Key
metadata.description: The system is not configured to require a strong session key.

metadata.title: Storage of Passwords and Credentials
metadata.description: The system is configured to permit storage of credentials or .NET Passports.

metadata.title: Everyone Anonymous Rights
metadata.description: The system must not be configured to give anonymous users Everyone rights.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Sharing and Security Model for Local Accounts
metadata.description: The system is not configured to use the Classic security model.

metadata.title: LAN Manager Hash Value Stored
metadata.description: The system is configured to store the LAN Manager hash of the password in the SAM.

metadata.title: Force Logoff When Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: The system must be configured to force users to log off when their allowed logon hours expire.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: LDAP Client Signing
metadata.description: The system is not configured to recommended LDAP client signing requirements.

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Clients
metadata.description: The system is not configured to meet the minimum requirement for session security for NTLM SSP based Clients.

metadata.title: FIPS Compliant Algorithms
metadata.description: The system is not configured to use FIPS compliant Algorithms for Encryption, Hashing, and Signing.

metadata.title: Case Insensitivity for Non-Windows
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow case insensitivity.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Session Limit
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services must limit users to one remote session.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Restrict Remote Desktop Services users to a Single Remote Desktop Services Session' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Password Prompting
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services must always prompt a client for passwords upon connection.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Always prompt for password upon connection' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Set Encryption Level
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured with the client connection encryption set to the required level.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Do Not Use Temp Folders
metadata.description: Terminal Services is configured to use a common temporary folder for all sessions.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Delete Temp Folders
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured to delete temporary folders.

metadata.title: Group Policy - Do Not Turn off Background Refresh
metadata.description: Group Policies must be refreshed in the background if the user is logged on.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn Off Background Refresh of Group Policy' is set to 'Disabled'
Verifies 'DisableBkGndGroupPolicy' registry value is set to '0'

metadata.title: Remote Assistance - Offer Remote Assistance
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow unsolicited remote assistance offers.

metadata.title: Safe DLL Search Mode
metadata.description: The system must be configured to use Safe DLL Search Mode.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (SafeDllSearchMode) Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Media Player - Disable Automatic Updates
metadata.description: Media Player is configured to allow automatic checking for updates.

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Servers
metadata.description: The system is not configured to meet the minimum requirement for session security for NTLM SSP based Servers.

metadata.title: Audit Log Warning Level
metadata.description: The system must generate an audit event when the audit log reaches a percentage of full threshold.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (WarningLevel) Percentage threshold for the security event log at which the system will generate a warning' is set to 90 percent or less

metadata.title: Disable IP Source Routing
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent IP source routing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'

metadata.title: Disable ICMP Redirect
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent ICMP redirects from overriding OSPF generated routes.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Disable Router Discovery
metadata.description: The system must be configured to disable the Internet Router Discovery Protocol (IRDP).

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (PerformRouterDiscovery) Allow IRDP to detect and configure Default Gateway addresses (could lead to DoS)' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: TCP Connection Keep-Alive Time
metadata.description: The system must be configured to limit how often keep-alive packets are sent.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (KeepAliveTime) How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds' is set to '300000 or 5 minutes (recommended)' or less

metadata.title: Name-Release Attacks
metadata.description: The system must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TCP Data Retransmissions
metadata.description: The system must limit how many times unacknowledged TCP data is retransmitted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is the default)' is set to 3 or less

metadata.title: Screen Saver Grace Period
metadata.description: The system must be configured to have password protection take effect within a limited time frame when the screen saver becomes active.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (ScreenSaverGracePeriod) The time in seconds before the screen saver grace period expires (0 recommended)' is set to 5 or less

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths and Sub-Paths
metadata.description: Unauthorized remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths must not be configured.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub paths' is configured to contain authorized registry paths
Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub paths' is not configured
Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub paths' is configured but contains no entries

metadata.title: Strong Key Protection
metadata.description: Users are not required to enter a password to access private keys.

metadata.title: Optional Subsystems
metadata.description: Optional Subsystems must not be permitted to operate on the system.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System Settings: Optional Subsystems' is blank

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Secure RPC Connection
metadata.description: The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure RPC communications.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Require secure RPC communication' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Group Policy - Registry Policy Processing
metadata.description: Group Policy objects are not reprocessed if they have not changed.

metadata.title: Encrypting and Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted or signed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows Server SMB client is not enabled to always perform SMB packet signing.

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows Server SMB server is not enabled to always perform SMB packet signing.

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Named Pipes and Shares
metadata.description: Named Pipes and Shares can be accessed anonymously.

metadata.title: Minimum Password Length
metadata.description: For systems utilizing a logon ID as the individual identifier, passwords are not at a minimum of 14-characters.

metadata.title: Display of Last User Name
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow the display of the last user name on the logon screen.

metadata.title: Audit Access to Global System Objects
metadata.description: Audit Access to Global System Objects is not turned off.

metadata.title: Audit Backup and Restore Privileges
metadata.description: Audit of Backup and Restore Privileges is not turned off.

metadata.title: Audit Policy Subcategory Setting
metadata.description: Audit policy using subcategories is enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (NoDefaultExempt) Configure IPSec exemptions for various types of network traffic' is set to 'Only ISAKMP is exempt (recommended for Windows Server 2003)'

metadata.title: UAC - Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: User Account Control - Built In Admin Approval Mode

metadata.title: UAC - Admin Elevation Prompt
metadata.description: User Account Control must, at a minimum, prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop'
Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for consent on the secure desktop'
Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for credentials'
Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for consent'

metadata.title: UAC - User Elevation Prompt
metadata.description: User Account Control must automatically deny standard user requests for elevation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users' is set to 'Automatically deny elevation requests'

metadata.title: UAC - Application Installations
metadata.description: User Account Control - Detect Application Installations

metadata.title: UAC - UIAccess Application Elevation

metadata.title: UAC - Secure Desktop Mode

metadata.title: UAC - Non UAC Compliant Application Virtualization
metadata.description: User Account Control - Non UAC Compliant Application Virtualization

metadata.title: Enumerate Administrator Accounts on Elevation

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Prevent Password Saving
metadata.description: Terminal Services / Remote Desktop Service - Prevent password saving in the Remote Desktop Client

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Drive Redirection
metadata.description: Terminal Services / Remote Desktop Services - Local drives prevented from sharing with Terminal Servers.

metadata.title: Internet Download / Online Ordering
metadata.description: Web Publishing and online ordering wizards prevented from downloading list of providers.

metadata.title: HTTP Printer Drivers
metadata.description: Computer prevented from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.

metadata.title: Windows Update Device Drive Searching
metadata.description: Windows is prevented from using Windows Update to search for drivers.

metadata.title: Event Viewer Events.asp Links
metadata.description: Event Viewer Events.asp links must be turned off.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off Event Viewer Events.asp' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Windows Explorer - Shell Protocol Protected Mode
metadata.description: Windows Explorer - Shell Protocol Protected Mode

metadata.title: Media Player - First Use Dialog Boxes
metadata.description: Users must not be presented with Privacy and Installation options on first use of Windows Media Player.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Network - WCN Wireless Configuration
metadata.description: Network - Windows Connect Now Wireless Configuration

metadata.title: Device Install - PnP Interface Remote Access

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Allow remote access to the Plug and Play interface' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Device Install - Drivers System Restore Point

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Prevent creation of a system restore point during device activity that would normally prompt creation of a restore point' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Device Install - Generic Driver Error Report
metadata.description: An Error Report must not be sent when a generic device driver is installed.

metadata.title: Driver Install - Device Driver Search Prompt
metadata.description: Driver Install - Device Driver Search Prompt

metadata.title: Handwriting Recognition Error Reporting

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off handwriting recognition error reporting' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Power Mgmt - Password Wake on Battery
metadata.description: Users must be prompted for a password on resume from sleep on battery. Applicable to Server 2008 R2 if the system is configured to sleep.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Require a Password When a Computer Wakes (On Battery)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Power Mgmt - Password Wake When Plugged In
metadata.description: Users must be prompted for a password on resume from sleep when plugged in. Applicable to Server 2008 R2 if the system is configured to sleep.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Require a Password When a Computer Wakes (Plugged In)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Game Explorer Information Downloads
metadata.description: Game explorer information must not be downloaded from Windows Metadata Services.

criterion.comment: Verifies ''Turn off downloading of game information' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Media DRM - Internet Access
metadata.description: Windows Media Digital Rights Management (DRM) must be prevented from accessing the Internet.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Prevent Windows Media DRM Internet Access' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Software Certificate Installation Files
metadata.description: Software certificate installation files must be removed from a system.

criterion.comment: Software certificate installation files (*.p12 *.pfx) are not present on the system

metadata.title: UAC - UIAccess Secure Desktop
metadata.description: UIAccess applications must not be allowed to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Allow UIAccess applications to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - COM Port Redirection
metadata.description: Users must be prevented from mapping local COM ports and redirecting data from the Remote Desktop Session Host to local COM ports.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not allow COM port redirection' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - LPT Port Redirection
metadata.description: Users must be prevented from mapping local LPT ports and redirecting data from the Remote Desktop Session Host to local LPT ports.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not allow LPT port redirection' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - PNP Device Redirection

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not allow supported Plug and Play device redirection' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Smart Card Device Redirection
metadata.description: The system must be configured to ensure smart card devices can be redirected to the Remote Desktop session.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not allow smart card device redirection' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Printer Redirection
metadata.description: The system must be configured to allow only the default client printer to be redirected in the Remote Desktop session.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Redirect only the default client printer' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program
metadata.description: Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program is disabled.

metadata.title: UR: Debug Programs
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Debug programs user right.

criterion.comment: Debug Programs - Administrators

metadata.title: SPN Target Name Validation Level
metadata.description: The service principal name (SPN) target name validation level must be turned off.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Server SPN target name validation level' is set to 'Off'

metadata.title: Computer Identity Authentication for NTLM
metadata.description: Services using Local System that use negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication must use the computer identity vs. authenticating anonymously.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Allow Local System to use computer identity for NTLM' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: NTLM NULL Session Fallback
metadata.description: NTLM must be prevented from falling back to a Null session.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: PKU2U Online Identities Authentication
metadata.description: PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Kerberos Encryption Types
metadata.description: Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES encryption suites.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos' is set to 'Enabled' with 'RC4_HMAC_MD5', 'AES128_HMAC_SHA1', 'AES256_HMAC_SHA1', 'Future encryption types'

metadata.title: IPv6 Source Routing
metadata.description: IPv6 source routing must be configured to the highest protection level.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'

metadata.title: IPv6 TCP Data Retransmissions
metadata.description: IPv6 TCP data retransmissions must be configured to prevent resources from becoming exhausted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions IPv6) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is the default)' is set to 3 or less

metadata.title: Elevate when setting a networks location
metadata.description: Domain users must be required to elevate when setting a networks location.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Require domain users to elevate when setting a network's location' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Direct Access - Route Through Internal Network
metadata.description: All Direct Access traffic must be routed through the internal network.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Route all traffic through the internal network' is set to 'Enabled: Enabled State'

metadata.title: Windows Update Point and Print Driver Search
metadata.description: Windows Update must be prevented from searching for point and print drivers.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Extend Point and Print connection to search Windows Update' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Prevent device metadata retrieval from Internet
metadata.description: Device metadata retrieval from the Internet must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Prevent device metadata retrieval from internet' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Prevent Windows Update for device driver search
metadata.description: Device driver searches using Windows Update must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Specify search order for device driver source locations' is set to 'Enabled: Do not search Windows Update'

metadata.title: MSDT Interactive Communication
metadata.description: Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT) interactive communication with Microsoft must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool: Turn on MSDT interactive communication with Support Provider' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Windows Online Troubleshooting Service
metadata.description: Access to Windows Online Troubleshooting Service (WOTS) must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Troubleshooting: Allow users to access online troubleshooting content on Microsoft servers from the Troubleshooting Control Panel (via Windows Online Troubleshooting Service - WOTS)' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Disable PerfTrack
metadata.description: Responsiveness events must be prevented from being aggregated and sent to Microsoft.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enable/Disable PerfTrack' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Application Compatibility Program Inventory
metadata.description: The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off Program Inventory' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Autoplay for non-volume devices
metadata.description: Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Turn Off Game Updates
metadata.description: Downloading of game update information must be turned off.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off game updates' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Prevent Joining Homegroup

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Prevent the computer from joining a homegroup' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Windows Anytime Upgrade

metadata.title: Explorer Data Execution Prevention

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous SAM Enumeration

metadata.title: Legal Banner Dialog Box Title

Legal Notice Caption - US Department of Defense Warning Statement

metadata.title: UR: Allow log on locally
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Allow log on locally user right.

criterion.comment: Allow log on locally - Administrators

metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services user right.
